website_summaries.verdict: The MSI AM1I is a Mini-ITX motherboard that delivers a solid feature set for just a few dollars more than the very cheapest AM1 boards.
pros: Layout is savvy for the most part

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This kit is holding up beyond my expectations. I currently have it in a cheapo cased stuffed into the top closet in my semi truck with little ventilation. It has been in there for two months. Every time I start the truck it reboots (because of my inverter, not the motherboard) but it keeps on running! (luckily I had a spare ssd to cut the boot time) I use this as a rolling Plex Media Server in Ubuntu. Two clients (one iPad and one android tablet) have streamed large media without a hiccup. Not sure how hot it gets since AMD and Linux temperature sensor software/drivers don't play nicely. Frankly, I'm scared to look!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing features for the $37 I paid for it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it years ago and it still works well. Amazing features for the $37 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Zanny

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: First time using AMD orientated motherboard. It's great for such a low price. An for people like my sister, whom I bought it for, who does college projects, surf the web, strem music/videos, and so on. It's a great match with the AMD Sempron 2650 APU.
customer_reviews.author: fbc

customer_reviews.title: Great mobo
customer_reviews.text: The last time I tried an MSI board, I had a bit of bad luck and ended up returning it. The price was right on this guy, though, so I pulled the trigger. Good decision, works great. Using it in an HTPC build. Only problem I had was when I realized it only has two SATA ports. My fault, I didn't look closely enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: How to make this run silent!
customer_reviews.text: Great budget mobo for a low power Kabini build. This thing runs dead silent IF YOU SET THE BIOS correctly. By default it is actually very loud. To make it silent set the Smart fan setting to target CPU temp of 50 degrees with minimum fan speed of 37.5% DONE.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to wire up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to wire up, even in a mini-ITX case. The instructions that come with it are a little unclear, but the pictures make up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Allen

customer_reviews.title: Decent motherboard... my first experience with MSI ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent motherboard...my first experience with MSI as I usually stick with ASUS or ASROCK. I wish it had more than 2 6g sata ports and on board support for USB 3 rather than just the 2 USB3 connections in back.
customer_reviews.author: J Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motherboard for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect motherboard for a media server. I paired it with the AMD Athlon 5350 APU and 8gb of ram and they run XBMC and Media Browser 3 from a 2tb Seagate hard drive without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Bishop

customer_reviews.title: This is cheap among mini-ITX motherboards and was easy to install after watching the MSI Youtube videos
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap among mini-ITX motherboards and was easy to install after watching the MSI Youtube videos. If your case has USB 3.0 ports, you may want to get an adapter like , as this has only USB 2.0 headers.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard. Plenty of features
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard. Plenty of features, convenient layout etc. Used for a media PC build. Can't beat the value or price.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: No 20 pin USB 3 header.
customer_reviews.text: Great board but lacks an on-board 20 USB 3 header.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Walker

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little motherboard. It works awesome as a low power audio/video playback system and has a lot of features for its size and price.
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: MSI is usually decent quality but this time I am disappointed. I'll have to see how the RMA goes
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. The first is fine after over two years. This one failed in a little over a month. MSI is usually decent quality but this time I am disappointed. I'll have to see how the RMA goes.
customer_reviews.author: Nestro

customer_reviews.title: Great especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these guys. No issues on either.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan P

customer_reviews.title: Great for a media server build
customer_reviews.text: Great for a media server build. Only thing I wish it had is an optical hook up for audio, but can manage around that utilizing the HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: Tono

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and kids play all there games on it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M Breaux

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for an ESXi host
customer_reviews.text: I bought this motherboard to build a virtual lab, basically to install an Hypervisor onto it. It works fine with ESXi 5.0, 5.1, and 5.5 (with injected drivers) BUT it the network card doesn't work on ESXi. They use a Realtek RT8168/8169 chip that doesn't work with the native RT driver that comes with ESXi, so I had to use the PCIe to put an extra network card which I was planning to use for extra SATA adapter. Overall is a good motherboard, I just wish they use another chip on the network card.
customer_reviews.author: DSR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is great for what its advertised would recommend​ 100% sure.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Z.

customer_reviews.title: Solid motherboard for a media centre pc!
customer_reviews.text: Great little motherboard. I'm using it with 4 GB ram and an AMD Sempron 2650 APU for a media centre pc and it's been running great! very stable. I've had this machine on since I got it and I haven't seen any stability issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Capable of using for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I built a small gaming PC from this using the NVIDIA GT 750 sc graphics card, and the 5350 APU with 8GB of RAM and a 1TB hard drive. This set up plays some of the best games! I play Call of Duty Ghost and COD Advance Warfare with no lag or problems at all! I can even play these games on high settings and still no lag!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Horrible description
customer_reviews.text: Horrible description. Never even powered it on since I need 6 sata ports like it said it had. Dont trust anything on this page not user generated
customer_reviews.author: Keith A

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked, easy to setup. One thing to note, that slow right next to the SATA ports is NOT a mSATA port. It's a mini PCIe slot. But that's me being dumb and not checking the manual. I have a 5350 that is ultra quiet with the stock fan (make sure to change the setting in the BIOS to silent the fan). It's in an Antec ISK 110 case. Running Windows 8.1 Pro with media center (wife friendly cable TV), plex client, netflix, etc. Everything runs great at 1080p. Minions looks better on it than my fire TV.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Kauspedas

customer_reviews.title: How to fix windows 10 sleep issues.
customer_reviews.text: Overall works good, some additional bios features could be impemented. However ive struggled extensively to get proper sleep to work under windows 10 (not hybrid sleep) as it would just reboot trying to wake up. This is a windows 10 issue and you need to tell windows to use the HPET to fix this problem. You can do this by typing "bcdedit /set useplatformclock true" in cmd as admin. Hopefully this can help someone having the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ivoh

customer_reviews.title: Great HTPC Motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard. AM1 processor choices are limited. This product is a miniITX despite the name saying its ATX. You can look up this same product on Newegg to confirm. Good choice for a Home Theater PC.
customer_reviews.author: Katsumi Richards

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Item was DOA, trying another one. Will update once the new mobo is here.
customer_reviews.author: Carth

product_meta.title: MSI AM1I Mini-ITX AMD Motherboard
product_meta.description: MSI AM1I: Socket AM1, SATA 6Gb/s, USB 3.0, 1 PCI-E x16, 1 Mini PCI-E, Mini-ITX Motherboard.
feature_bullets: Supports AMD Socket AM1 Athlon /Sempron Processors, Fast Boot: Quickly Boot Up & Enter OS in A Few Seconds
Supports DDR3 Memory, 3 Display Outputs: HDMI/DVI/D-Sub Support
USB 3.0 + SATA 6 GB/s, 4K UHD Support: Ultra-high Definition Visual Experience
